creator: dolfsmits@zonnet.nl
text:
The functional testmode should return all the data received. I used it 
to "sniff" the http pages that were returned in version 1.8.

With 1.9 latest release (build it from the CVS on aug 13th 21.00 MET
(as wel as with the release candidates)

now  setting the "functional test mode" on the testplan does not give me any 
output back. No difference can be found whether it is set or not.

creator: tjsb@slb.com
text:
Works for me. See attached Zip which has JMX and JTL files sampling ths same 
URL with and without functional mode.

Perhaps you could try the JMX and see what happens?

Or upload a simple JMX file that demonstrates the problem?

Created attachment 7815
Zip file containing jmx and jtl files to demo functional mode.
creator: tjsb@slb.com

text:
Yes, it works for me too.  If I had to guess, I'd say this user had their test
output set to 'csv' instead of 'xml' (a setting in jmeter.properties).  CSV test
output can't do functional style output.
creator: mstover1@apache.org

text:
Mike,

you were right again.
It was in csv mode.
I've been searching everywhere to find this , but could'n find this in the 
documentation.
I'll write an update for the docs next week.
creator: dolfsmits@zonnet.nl
